#summary Discussion of ratings systems

In addition to ranking teams by hand, there are numerous ways to rate teams numerically. 

=Debate Specific=

  * Many posts at [http://art-of-logic.blogspot.com/ The Art of Logic] discuss the ranking of teams by opponent wins, rather than by speaker points, in order to pair tournaments fairly.
  * [http://commweb.fullerton.edu/jbruschke/web/BruschkeExplanation.aspx Jon Bruschke's and Jim Hanson's team ratings algorithms] explained on DebateResultsDotCom

=Generic=

  * [http://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=1976262193035074609 "Ranking Participants in Tournaments by means of Rating Functions"] introduces the RecursivePerformance metric.
  * [http://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=1588533582049225873 "Ranking Participants in Generalized Tournaments"] uniquely characterizes one of the the FairBets metrics (specifically, the self-bounty-based one) and its dual.

=Other Domains=

  * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ratings_Percentage_Index The Ratings Percentage Index] for NCAA college basketball.
